title.narrative: SAFE WATER FACILITIES

description.narrative: Vulnerable and emergency-affected people have access to safe drinking water, which contributes to Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: New Element

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Vulnerable and emergency-affected people have access to safe drinking water

description.narrative: UNICEF continued to prioritize the delivery of sustainable WASH services focusing on vulnerable, underserved and emergency affected populations, to ensure safe water for children and their families. ;During 2021 the WASH programme provided critical life-saving interventions, reaching 78% of the targeted population in humanitarian situations and 171% in non-humanitarian settings, with access to basic safe water supply. ;Challenges in the water sector, coupled with unpreceded flooding, remain critical. Poor maintenance of the limited facilities, and fragmented and weak government institutions at all levels, coupled with limited funding and the pandemic, has led to an increase in gaps and inequities.;; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:11/01/2022
